question: Read the passage below and choose the most appropriate transition word or phrase to fill in the blank.
text: Jamal overcame a steep learning curve when he started playing the violin at a later age than most. He practiced diligently for hours each day. _____ his efforts, he earned a chair in the regional youth orchestra.
explanation: Correct choice B: "Because of." Jamalâ€™s intensive practice led directly to his success, so a cause-and-effect transition is needed. "In spite of" contradicts the notion that practice was beneficial, "On the contrary" introduces an opposing statement, and "Even so" would suggest a surprising outcome. Here, it's a straightforward result.
